sentences.sContent: Her mother had been dead for ten years.
Police are trying to contact the family of the dead man.
sentences.sCn: 警方在设法与死者的家属联系。

sentences.sContent: the dead body of a young soldier
Two men were shot dead by terrorists.
sentences.sCn: 两名男子遭恐怖分子枪杀。

sentences.sContent: Magnus was found dead in his car.
sentences.sCn: 马格纳斯被人发现死在他自己的车里。

sentences.sContent: One man is still missing, presumed dead .
sentences.sCn: 仍有一人失踪，被推定已经死亡。

sentences.sContent: He suddenly had a heart attack and dropped dead .
She was pronounced dead on arrival at the hospital.
sentences.sCn: 到达医院时她被宣告已经死亡。

sentences.sContent: His fellow climbers had left him for dead on the mountain.
sentences.sCn: 他的登山伙伴以为他已死，便把他留在山上走了。

sentences.sContent: We didn’t know if she was dead or alive.
sentences.sCn: 我们不知道她是死是活。

sentences.sContent: When they found him he was more dead than alive .
sentences.sCn: 他们发现他的时候，他已奄奄一息。

sentences.sContent: ...red does not always mean luckiness and happiness because in the past names of the dead were often written in red...
...his wife has been dead for years...

synos.tran: 无生命的；呆板的；废弃了的

phrases.pCn: adj. 完全正确的；十分精确的（等于dead-on）
死区（电波不能到达的地区）；盲区；静区
[美国俚语]当真，一点不假；老实说
预付的工资；旧债；无益的事
n. 没用的人，废物；无用的东西
[解]死腔；[解]无效区；[电子]无信号区

words.tran: 致命的；非常的；死一般的
致命；深仇大恨；不共戴天
死；死一样的状态；无精打采
死，死亡；枯萎；失去活力（die的ing形式）
变得如死一般；失去活力
